lead_paragraph: A massacre of at least 100 police officers and soldiers on Tuesday, among the worst in a forgotten war, hits forces already demoralized and struggling to fill their ranks.

byline.contributor: Zahra Nader and Najim Rahim contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and FAHIM ABED

headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces, Their Numbers Dwindling Sharply, Face a Resurgent Taliban
headline.main: Afghan Forces, Their Numbers Dwindling Sharply, Face a Resurgent Taliban

snippet: A massacre of at least 100 police officers and soldiers on Tuesday, among the worst in a forgotten war, hits forces already demoralized and struggling to fill their ranks....
abstract: Afghan officials announces killing of at least 100 members of Afghan security forces in massacre by Taliban fighters near southern city of Lashkar Gah; slaughter is indicative of growing crisis for country's armed forces as they sustain large numbers of casualties even as Taliban insurgency appears to be regaining strength.
